cdata.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 172, Number 12 (Friday, January 16, 2026)][House][Pages H924-H925]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. FROST:H.R. 7133.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:[[Page H925]]Article I, Section 8, Clauses 1 and 18 of the U.S.Constitution

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

bill.title: To prohibit States from prohibiting or otherwise deterring the usage of any merchant category code established by the International Organization for Standardization, including codes that identify firearm merchants and ammunition merchants.

item.title: To prohibit States from prohibiting or otherwise deterring the usage of any merchant category code established by the International Organization for Standardization, including codes that identify firearm merchants and ammunition merchants.

To prohibit States from prohibiting or otherwise deterring the usage of any merchant category code established by the International Organization for Standardization, including codes that identify firearm merchants and ammunition merchants.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Financial Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
